place.name: TRESLOTHAN
place.gazetteerText: TRESLOTHAN, a chapelry in Camborne parish, Cornwall; near Camborne r. station. It was constituted in 1845. Post town, Camborne, Cornwall. Pop., 1,804. Houses, 353. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of Exeter. Value, £130. Patron, not reported. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
